item.title: In Argentina, a Quiet Data Cruncher Aims to Bring Sense to a Raucous Election
item.description: A low-key data cruncher, Andy Tow, has emerged as a guide to Argentina’s contested presidential race. Along the way, he has won fame, influence and ire.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN GILBERT
item.media:description: Andy Tow, who says he has an “addiction” to statistics, at the National Congress. Argentines will elect a president on Sunday.

item.title: Stabbing Assault Wounds 4 Israelis
item.description: Four Israelis, including a 13-year-old girl, were stabbed and wounded in southern Israel on Saturday before the assailant fled, setting off a manhunt, the police said.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Brussels Placed at Highest Alert Level; Subway Is Closed
item.description: Prime Minister Charles Michel said raising the alert meant that the threat was “serious and imminent.”
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA
item.media:description: A soldier in central Brussels on Saturday, after the government raised the country’s threat level to its highest.

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: The Danger of Placing Your Chips on Beauty
item.description: Paris is a natural target for those who would destroy the human spirit.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ROGER COHEN
item.media:description: People in Paris observed a moment of silence on Monday for the victims of the Nov. 13 attacks.

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: How ISIS Defeats Us
item.description: If we can’t behave more logically than ideologically, we’re doomed.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: FRANK BRUNI

item.title: Hotel Attack in Mali Is a Setback in Fight Against Extremism
item.description: The fatal attack on a hotel in Mali’s capital leads to questions about how a democratic society can protect itself from a few determined extremists.
item.dc:creator: DIONNE SEARCEY, ADAM NOSSITER, CARLOTTA GALL and SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: Troops outside the Radisson Blu Hotel in Bamako, Mali, on Saturday, a day after at least 19 people from a number of countries were killed by terrorists.

item.title: Military Reviews U.S. Response to ISIS Rise
item.description: The Pentagon has seized a trove of emails and documents as it expands an inquiry into Central Command over allegations that officials overstated the progress of airstrikes against the Islamic State.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MATT APUZZO, MARK MAZZETTI and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT.
item.media:description: Iraqi gear littered the ground near an Iraqi Army checkpoint east of Mosul on June 11, 2014, a day after militants overran the city.

item.title: Mali Hotel Attackers Are Tied to an Algerian Qaeda Leader
item.description: A member of Al Qaeda said the attack on the Radisson Blu Hotel in Bamako was carried out by a jihadist group loyal to Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a Qaeda operative.
item.dc:creator: RUKMINI CALLIMACHI and NABIH BULOS

item.title: 9 Foreigners Killed in Mali Are Identified
item.description: The China Railway Construction Corporation said three men were killed by gunmen who attacked a hotel, and the airline Volga-Dnepr said six Russian employees were also killed.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR

item.title: Funeral in Pakistan for Militants Killed in U.S. Strikes Draws Hundreds
item.description: Twenty coffins were involved in the mass funeral for local militants said to have been killed in neighboring Afghanistan.
item.dc:creator: THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: State of Terror: ISIS Women and Enforcers in Syria Recount Collaboration, Anguish and Escape
item.description: Three young women who fled to southern Turkey recalled their experiences as members of the Islamic State morality police in Raqqa, Syria.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: AZADEH MOAVENI
item.media:credit: Tara Todras-Whitehill for The New York Times
item.media:description: Aws, 25, a former resident of Raqqa, Syria, used to be a member of the Khansaa Brigade, the Islamic State's female morality police. Her first husband was a jihadist, and when he died in a suicide operation she reluctantly agreed to marry another fighter.

item.title: Refugees Must Not Be Turned Away, Obama Says
item.description: President Obama, speaking in Malaysia, said the United States should not close itself to the world’s refugees out of fear as he met with children who have fled violence.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR
item.media:description: President Obama visited a center for child refugees on Saturday in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. He said such children should not be barred from entering the United States over security fears.

item.title: For Woman Dead in French Police Raid, Unlikely Path to Terror
item.description: Hasna Aitboulahcen once liked to drink, smoke and stay out late. She spent her last days in a St.-Denis hide-out for Islamist militants.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:description: An apartment building in the Paris suburb of St.-Denis a day after a raid by the French police.

item.title: U.S. Victim of Mali Attack Worked on Women’s Health
item.description: Anita Ashok Datar, an American who was killed in the Mali attack, was devoted to her young son and to helping women in poverty around the world.
item.dc:creator: LIAM STACK

item.title: World Briefing: 9 North Koreans Feared Deported
item.description: The United Nations expressed alarm about the fate of North Koreans feared to have been deported from Vietnam via China back to their homeland.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Lithuania: Misfires at AK-47’s Debut
item.description: Arming police officers with AK-47s led to an accidental shooting and the theft of a weapon — and to the resignation of the interior minister,
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Italy: 6 Arrested in Plot Against Official
item.description: The police arrested members of Sicily’s Cosa Nostra as part of an inquiry that uncovered a threat of violence against Interior Minister Angelino Alfano.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Paris Attacks Force European Union to Act on Border Controls
item.description: Officials met in an emergency session and vowed to complete French proposals for tighter controls by the end of the year.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: STEVEN ERLANGER
item.media:description: Bonfires in Gevgelija, Macedonia, helped migrants stay warm on Friday as they waited to enter a registration camp after crossing the border from Greece.

item.title: Migrants’ Attempts to Enter U.S. via Mexico Stoke Fears About Jihadists
item.description: Federal officials said the migrants — from Syria, Pakistan and Afghanistan — appeared to have no radical intentions, but the episodes added to concerns after the Paris attacks.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

item.title: Paris and Mali Attacks Expose Lethal Qaeda-ISIS Rivalry
item.description: The competition between the two groups, first provoked by differing strategies in Syria, will be hard to stamp out even if armies can weaken the jihadists in the Middle East and Africa.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ANNE BARNARD and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
